response_time.Description: Response time column not used for this data

sample.Description: Event sample starting at 0 (Matlab convention starting at 1)

Levels.171: Cue during standing previously associated with right heel strike
Levels.271: Cue during standing previously associated with left heel strike
Levels.100: Right heel strikes during uncued walking
Levels.200: Left heel strikes during uncued walking
Levels.114: First right cued step during preferred cadence walking
Levels.444: First auditory cue during preferred cadence walking
Levels.151: Auditory cues for right step during preferred cadence walking
Levels.251: Auditory cues for left step during preferred cadence walking
Levels.101: Right cued heel strikes during preferred cadence walking
Levels.201: Left cued heel strikes during preferred cadence walking
Levels.113: First right heel strike relative to step advance tempo shift
Levels.333: First auditory cue marking step advance tempo shift
Levels.153: Auditory cues for right heel strikes during step advance pacing tempo
Levels.253: Auditory cues for left heel strikes during step advance pacing tempo
Levels.103: Right cued heel strikes during step advance pacing tempo
Levels.203: Left cued heel strikes during step advance pacing tempo
Levels.119: First right heel strike relative to step delay tempo shift
Levels.999: First auditory cue marking step delay tempo shift
Levels.159: Auditory cues for right heel strikes during step delay pacing tempo
Levels.259: Auditory cues for left heel strikes during step delay pacing tempo
Levels.109: Right cued heel strikes during step delay pacing tempo
Levels.209: Left cued heel strikes during step delay pacing tempo

trial_type.Description: Upper hierarchy for events in the experiment

Levels.CuedStanding: Period of 4 min standing while listening to cues at the pace of the participants preferred walking cadence
Levels.UncuedWalking: Period of uncued walking at the beginning of each trial
Levels.PreferredCadence: Period of walking with auditory cue sequence - auditory cues arriveat the tempo of the participants preferred cadence
Levels.AdvanceTempo: Unexpected shift in the cue sequence to a faster pacing tempo.Participants are required to synchronize with the new cue tempo
Levels.DelayTempo: Unexpected shift in the cue sequence to a slower pacing tempo.Participants are required to synchronize with the new cue tempo
